Description: Ensures that each customer_id in tsb.customer_data_bank is unique, verifying the integrity of the primary key constraint.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank GROUP BY customer_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

Description: Checks that all records in tsb.customer_data_bank have a non-null customer_id, as required by the NOT NULL constraint.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE customer_id IS NULL

Description: Validates that age values in tsb.customer_data_bank are non-negative, ensuring logical consistency for age data.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE age IS NOT NULL AND age < 0

Description: Checks that date_of_birth values are not set in the future, maintaining realistic birth date information.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE date_of_birth IS NOT NULL AND date_of_birth > CURRENT_DATE

Description: Verifies that created_on is populated for all records, ensuring auditability and traceability of customer creation events.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE created_on IS NULL

Description: Checks for duplicate email_address entries in tsb.customer_data_bank, which may indicate data entry errors or duplicate customers.
Custom_SQL: SELECT email_address, COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE email_address IS NOT NULL GROUP BY email_address HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

Description: Ensures that email_address values conform to a basic email format, reducing risk of invalid contact information.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE email_address IS NOT NULL AND email_address !~* '^[A-Za-z0-9._%+-]+@[A-Za-z0-9.-]+\.[A-Za-z]{2,}$'

Description: Checks for duplicate national_id_or_passport_number entries, which may indicate identity conflicts or duplicate records.
Custom_SQL: SELECT national_id_or_passport_number, COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE national_id_or_passport_number IS NOT NULL GROUP BY national_id_or_passport_number HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

Description: Checks for missing status values to ensure that every customer record has a defined status.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE status IS NULL

Description: Validates that status values are within the expected domain (e.g., Active, Inactive, Suspended), ensuring consistent status assignment.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE status IS NOT NULL AND status NOT IN ('Active','Inactive','Suspended')

Description: Ensures that gender values are within the expected set (e.g., Male, Female, Other), reducing ambiguity and improving reporting accuracy.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE gender IS NOT NULL AND gender NOT IN ('Male','Female','Other')

Description: Checks for missing full_name values, which are critical for customer identification.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE full_name IS NULL

Description: Checks that phone_number values conform to a basic phone number format, reducing risk of invalid contact information.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE phone_number IS NOT NULL AND phone_number !~ '^[0-9+\-\(\) ]{7,20}$'

Description: Checks for missing account_numbers values, which may indicate incomplete customer records.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE account_numbers IS NULL

Description: Ensures that modified_on is not earlier than created_on, maintaining logical consistency in audit timestamps.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE modified_on IS NOT NULL AND created_on IS NOT NULL AND modified_on < created_on

Description: Checks for missing created_by values to ensure auditability of who created each customer record.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE created_by IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing modified_by values when modified_on is present, ensuring proper audit trail for record modifications.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE modified_on IS NOT NULL AND modified_by IS NULL

Description: Ensures that customer_type values are within an expected set (e.g., Individual, Corporate, SME), supporting consistent classification.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE customer_type IS NOT NULL AND customer_type NOT IN ('Individual','Corporate','SME')

Description: Checks for missing occupation values, which may be required for certain regulatory or business processes.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE occupation IS NULL

Description: Checks that account_numbers values conform to a basic account number format (alphanumeric, commas for multiple accounts), reducing risk of invalid account references.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE account_numbers IS NOT NULL AND account_numbers !~ '^[A-Za-z0-9, ]+$'
